title: [Feature] - Enhance Language Selection UX: Fix Position or Restrict Height of Code Snippet List
body:
### What feature would you like to see?

**Problem Statement:**

- Currently, the language selection box is placed in the aside section. When a user selects "All Snippets," multiple code snippets are displayed on the right side. If the user scrolls down significantly, they need to scroll back up again to change the language, which disrupts the user experience.

<hr/>

**Proposed Solution:**

To improve usability, we can implement one of the following solutions:

- Fix the Position: Make the language selection box sticky so that it remains visible when the user scrolls down.
- Restrict the Code Snippet List Height: Limit the height of the code snippet list and make it scrollable, ensuring the language selection box remains accessible without extra scrolling.

<hr/>

**Expected Benefits:**

- Enhances user experience by making language switching more convenient.
- Reduces unnecessary scrolling, especially when many snippets are displayed.
- Improves accessibility and usability for users navigating through large lists of code snippets.
author: Devamchaudhari

comments.body:
Hey, there! Thanks for suggesting the idea. Yeah, we need to consider this as well. 

Both suggestions are good. Let me know which one you would prefer. Personally, I like the 2nd idea because categories are likely grow as well and we might have to set a height for it in the future. Therefore, perhaps, setting heights for both categories and snippets? I'm open to listening your thoughts on this.

Hey @dostonnabotov , üòä I agree with you, I also prefer the second idea. Since categories might expand in the future, setting a fixed height for both the categories and snippets makes sense. This approach ensures better scalability while keeping the UI clean‚ú® and accessible.
@Devamchaudhari, let me know if you plan to make a PR for it.
@dostonnabotov  Sure! I'll start working on it üòäand raise a PR soon

title: [Snippets] Added String Manipulation Snippets for java
body:
<!-- **ANY PULL REQUEST NOT FOLLOWING GUIDELINES OR NOT INCLUDING A DESCRIPTION WILL BE CLOSED !** -->

# Description

I added multiple string manipulation snippets for java including:

1. case conversion (7)
- string to Titlecase
- string to snake_case
- string to PascalCase
- string to param-case
- string to camelCase
- camcelCase <-> snake_case 

2. other conversions (6)
- space <-> tabs
- string <-> unicode
- string <-> ascii list

3. string normalisation (5)
- slugify string
- capatalize words
- remove punctuation
- remove special characters
- normalize whitespaces (consecutive whitespaces to single space)

4. other text transformations (5)
- truncate string
- mask text
- extract text between to delimiters
- reverse word contents
- reverse word order

5. string analyzing (8)
- count character frequency in string
- count consonants
- count vowels
- count words
- find unique characters
- find longest word
- is palindrome
- is anagram

6. other (1)
- password generator

author: dibyam-jalan27

comments.body: I am using windows and unable to commit due to prettier rules. How can i fix that?

Can you please run 
- `npm install`
- `npm run snippets:check`

If you are sure your commit is well formatted you can skip GitHub hook

It is strange that it doesn't allow you to commit since pre-commit hook doesn't contain any prettier related formatting.

Lastly I can only recommend to hard reset branch and open a new PR
We won't help you if you close your PR definitely. Please open it again if you want to seek support.
(Eslint runs prettier so it's probably why it fails, but I have no clue why it fails above that)

title: [Feature] - Add a page to see every snippets for one language
body:
### What feature would you like to see?

## What is being requested?
I would like to have the ability to view all snippets for a single language, rather than being restricted to seeing one category at a time. This would allow me to look through all snippets and potentially find some cool code that I would've never found, without having to manually scroll up and switch categories.

## Can I implement this myself?
- [ ] Able to fully implement this myself.
- [x] Able to partially implement this myself, would need to learn.
- [x] Unable to implement this myself, open to learning and doing so.
- [ ] Unable to implement this myself, asking for someone else to implement this.

title: Added code snippets of C++ on bit manipulation, math & number, searching, sorting
body:

# Description
Added code snippets for **C++**:

1. **Math and Number Category** snippets:
    - Binary to decimal conversion
    - Check if the number is perfect number
    - Calculate the factorial of a number using recursion
    - Find the nth fibonacci number using recursion
    - Calculate greatest comman divisor(GCD)
    - Calculate the least comman multiple(LCM)
    - Calculate the sum of digits of a number

2. Added new **Bit Manipulation Category**
    - Check if a given number is power of 2 
    - Count set bits in a number
    - Find the non repeating number in array
    - Reverse bits
    - Calculate the XOR over 1 to n(provided by user)

3. Added new **Searching Category**
    - Linear Search
    - Binary Search

4. Added new **Sorting Category**
    - Bubble sort
    - Insertion sort
    - Merge sort
    - Quick sort

comments.body:
A lot of the bit manipulation should be moved to C. They are not exactly specific for C++, except for the vector one.
C++ STL provides functions for sorting and searching. They don't need to be in the Snippets.

> A lot of the bit manipulation should be moved to C. They are not exactly specific for C++, except for the vector one. C++ STL provides functions for sorting and searching. They don't need to be in the Snippets.

Ok I will remove the searching and sorting part from the snippets.
But for bit manipulation it is not only for c, we could also do bit manipulation in C++.  So we could keep that in both the languages

Hey, I understand that bit manipulation isn't exclusive to C and can also be done in C++. However, since the snippets don't use any C++-specific features (at least no big one) and are more aligned with C-style programming, it makes sense to categorize them under C.

> Hey, I understand that bit manipulation isn't exclusive to C and can also be done in C++. However, since the snippets don't use any C++-specific features (at least no big one) and are more aligned with C-style programming, it makes sense to categorize them under C.

Got it, thanks for pointing out. I‚Äôll make the changes to categorize the snippets under C accordingly.

I have moved all the snippets of bit manipulation to C except the find the non repeating element in vector as vector is supported only in C++. 
I have also removed the searching and sorting snippets and gcd and lcm snippets as it is present in C++ stl.
All the mentioned snippets moved to C

title: Updating to use vite HMR to consolidate snippets
body:
<!-- **ANY PULL REQUEST NOT FOLLOWING GUIDELINES OR NOT INCLUDING A DESCRIPTION WILL BE CLOSED !** -->

# Description

Removes the need to run `snippets:consolidate` to consolidate snippets, instead we are now using a custom vite plugin that builds snippets when vite runs (build or dev mode).
It allows for less conflicts on PRs, and leaves the responsability of consolidating to the server instead of leaving the repo store them.

TLDR: consolidated snippets removed, workflow removed, custom plugin in vite config to consolidate.

## Type of Change

<!-- What kind of change does this pull request introduce? (Check all that apply) -->

- [ ] ‚ú® New snippet
- [ ] üõ† Improvement to an existing snippet
- [ ] üêû Bug fix
- [ ] üìñ Documentation update
- [X] üîß Other (please describe): Consolidating fixes/changes
author: Mathys-Gasnier

comments.body: Awesome work. We also need to update the guidelines for contributors.

title: [Feature] - Language Tags
body:
### What feature would you like to see?

Hey, I really like the idea behind this project, however, I am not sure how you'd handle cases such as the Unity game engine which uses C#, as well as UXML and USS.
What came to my mind is, instead of using a single language per snippet, why not implement tags?
This way, you could select, for example, Unity and it would give you all the things with the Unity tag, such as C#, uxml and uss(UI Toolkit) snippets etc.
Or even select multiple tags at once, e.g. JS and TS, and get results for both at the same time.
A nice addition would be tag exclusion(e.g. right clicking on the selection), which would exclude a certain tag from the search.
This could be useful if you wanna find UI Toolkit snippets only(UXML and USS), but not C# scripts.
This is just an idea and I don't know if it fits your vision of the project, good luck either way!
author: nnra6864

comments.body:
Tags are already implemented, the search feature is under development.
Supporting frameworks, game engines and such is being worked on in #136.
Closing as duplicate

title: Add Fibonacci Series Snippets in Multiple Languages and Fix Workflow Commit Error
body:
<!-- **ANY PULL REQUEST NOT FOLLOWING GUIDELINES OR NOT INCLUDING A DESCRIPTION WILL BE CLOSED !** -->

# Description

This PR adds new snippet files for the Fibonacci series in multiple programming languages, each placed under the appropriate folders and following the guidelines from the `CONTRIBUTING.md`. Specifically, it includes:

- **C** ‚Äì Iterative function in `snippets/c/basic/fibonacci-series.md`
- **C++** ‚Äì Iterative function in `snippets/cpp/basic/fibonacci-series.md`
- **C#** ‚Äì Iterative function in `snippets/csharp/basic/fibonacci-series.md`
- **Python** ‚Äì Iterative function in `snippets/python/basic/fibonacci-series.md`
- **Java** ‚Äì Iterative function in `snippets/java/basic/fibonacci-series.md`
- **JavaScript** ‚Äì Iterative function in `snippets/javascript/basic/fibonacci-series.md`
- **Rust** ‚Äì Iterative function in `snippets/rust/basic/fibonacci-series.md`

Each snippet has:

1. A front matter section with `title`, `description`, `tags`, and `author`.
2. A simple iterative implementation of Fibonacci.
3. An example usage showing how to call the function and an expected output.

---

## Fix for Workflow Error

Additionally, this PR **fixes** a workflow error where the GitHub Actions job fails with an exit code of `1` if there are **no changes** to commit in the `public/consolidated` or `public/icons` directories. 
<!-- Include a summary of your changes. -->

author: Karanjot786

comments.body:
Hey, Thank you for your contribution.

After reviewing we notice that your PR doesn't follow our guidelines.
- Your snippets don't return any value instead they print them
- The C and C++ snippets are pretty much the same
- Some snippets already exists to calculate fibonacci
- You modify the workflow in a snippet PR
- Normally we also like to avoid having multiple languages in the same PR, but as this has only one type of snippet it's not that bad.

You can find them in `CONTRIBUTING.md` in the root of the repo. If you have any question or want to contest this decision please send a message in your PR explaining your position.

**If no fix is provided within 7-10 days this PR will be closed without further notice**

Hi @Mathys-Gasnier,

Thank you for taking the time to review my PR. I appreciate the detailed feedback.

### Snippets Returning vs. Printing
- I can update each snippet to return the Fibonacci value instead of printing it. That way, it aligns with the project‚Äôs guidelines to return a result rather than produce console output.

### C and C++ Snippets
- Yes, they appear very similar, but I included both because the syntax and file extensions differ between the two languages. Please let me know if you‚Äôd prefer a single snippet or a different approach.

### Existing Fibonacci Snippets
- I couldn‚Äôt find any existing Fibonacci snippets in the repo. Could you please point me in the right direction or provide a link? I‚Äôd be happy to remove duplicates or update mine to avoid overlap if they exist.

### Workflow Changes
- I‚Äôll remove the workflow changes from this PR. I understand that changes to the workflow should be in a dedicated PR, so I‚Äôll open a separate one for that.

### Multiple Languages in One PR
- Since these are the same snippet concepts in different languages, I added them together. However, if you prefer separate PRs for each language in the future, please let me know, and I‚Äôll adjust my approach.

Please let me know if you have any further suggestions or need clarifications. If you can direct me to where the existing Fibonacci snippets are located, I‚Äôll ensure my changes adhere to the existing code.

Thank you again for your guidance, and I look forward to making the necessary revisions!

Hey, there! Thanks for the contribution.

After reviewing your snippets, we realized that we can't accept them. Fibonacci is more of an algorithm rather than a code snippet. And, the problem with algorithms is that they can be applied in every language, which creates duplicates like in this case. Therefore, it doesn't fit the scope of QuickSnip.

author: dkyan33

comments.body:
Hey, Thank you for your contribution.

After reviewing your PR we've found that all/some snippets you are adding don't match the scope of Quicksnip.
This snippet wraps around a JS function without adding any functionnality above it.

Please remove the PR that don't match the scope (Listed bellow), if your PR contains no snippet matching the scope of Quicksnip, it will be closed without further notice.

**If no fix is provided within 7-10 days this PR will be closed without further notice**

author: 1982FenceHopper

comments.body:
Hey, Thank you for your contribution.

After reviewing your PR we've found that all/some snippets you are adding don't match the scope of Quicksnip.
Your snippets acts more like a documentation explaining how to add audio to a page, more than a snippet, providing a function (See guidelines).
I will not close your PR, if you want to fix this snippet so it's more inline with what we expect. If not feel free to close the PR

**If no fix is provided within 7-10 days this PR will be closed without further notice**

Ah, I see

I'll go ahead and close the PR for this then, since I have another idea for a snippet that actually is just a snippet :)

title: [Feature] - Bash snippets support
body:

What about to add script examples for Linux based prompts? ;)

Sorry, missclicked on the close button
Some bash snippets were merged recently, so i'm considering this as done

title: Add Sieve of Eratosthenes algorithm snippet in C++
body:
<!-- **ANY PULL REQUEST NOT FOLLOWING GUIDELINES OR NOT INCLUDING A DESCRIPTION WILL BE CLOSED !** -->

# Description

Added a new snippet for the **Sieve of Eratosthenes** algorithm, which efficiently generates all prime numbers up to a given maximum value. The code demonstrates the classic sieve approach with an optimized marking process for identifying primes.

## Type of Change

<!-- What kind of change does this pull request introduce? (Check all that apply) -->

- [X] ‚ú® New snippet
- [ ] üõ† Improvement to an existing snippet

- [ ] My code follows the style and contribution guidelines of this project.
- [ ] Comments are added where necessary for clarity.
- [ ] Documentation has been updated (if applicable).
- [ ] There are no new warnings or errors from my changes.

## Related Issues

<!-- Link any relevant issues (use #issue-number syntax). If not, leave it empty -->

Closes #

## Additional Context

This snippet provides an efficient implementation of the Sieve of Eratosthenes to calculate primes. It's suitable for use in applications that require prime number generation up to a specified maximum limit.

title: [Feature] - Markdown for further description or usage
body:
### What feature would you like to see?

_No response_
author: ascndia

comments.body:
Hey, as you didn't provide any more information on the feature you want to see i'm closing this issue.
If you want, you can re open it with more information about the feature you wanna see.

title: [Feature] - Localisation (support for multiple languages)
body:
### What feature would you like to see?

I think localisation support could be useful. This should be straightforward to implement in the app itself (and I am happy to do so if this is a popular), but may prove challenging when dealing with the actual snippets because of code comments, etc., and this aspect may require more thought.
author: barrymun

comments.body: Thank you for the feature request. This could an idea in the long future. Right now, our focus is building and maintaining the core of our project. As the time goes on, the project will be refined further, which could create a need for localization.

title: [Bug] - search bar does not work
body:
### What bug did you find in the codebase?

The search bar is not functional , is this still yet to be implemented?
( also , really cool project btw!)
author: mayur1377

comments.body:
Hey, there! Thanks for checking out the project. üôå

> The search bar is not functional , is this still yet to be implemented?

Yeah, it's currently being implemented by our community in this pull request #34
sure thing! :)

title: [Feature] - Add snippets in markdown instead Json.
body:
### What feature would you like to see?

While adding code in array it gets hard to manage indentation.

And we can use something like directories and files with markdown.
and properties too for storing metadata and a category json.

Similar to docusaurus setup.
author: aumirza

comments.body: This is already being fixed by #39, we will not change the format used to save snippets, but instead provide tools that makes it easier to create snippets.

title: [Feature] - Make a snippet shareable
body:
### What feature would you like to see?

For each of the snippet, have a direct link to the snippet. Similar to how sharing a specific answer of a StackOverflow question. Use case would be something like show something that has already been done through the specific code snippet over on Whatsapp/Discord/Telegram.
author: Qoyyuum

comments.body: This is currently being worked on with the search bar. Where you are in the website will be in the URL so it's shareable
This feature is successfully implemented. Closing the issue.

title: framework choice and scalability
body:
For future scalability we should use nextjs.
instead of a single javascript.json file we should use a javascript folder then we can use multiple json file for example
* cpp
* css
* python
  * ListManipulation-1.json
  * ListManipulation-2.json
* javascript
  * ArrayManipulation-1.json
  * ArrayManipulation-2.json
  * StringManipulation-1.json
  * StringManipulation-2.json
  * etc.......
author: JaberChowdhury

comments.body:
The structure seems good currently, it can and will support lot of snippets, there are no really need to switch to nextjs...
Also we already discussed in #16 on how we could improve the current storage/user experience on making snippets.
What comes out of it is a tool to help create snippets, and we keep the current storage, at least for the moment.

The current way of storing snippets isn't the most ideal, but it does it's job great.

title: Add .prettierrc file
body:
Needed for consistent formatting.

### Proposed Solution
`./.prettierrc`
```json
{
  "semi": true,
  "tabWidth": 2,
  "printWidth": 80,
  "singleQuote": false,
  "trailingComma": "es5",
  "bracketSpacing": true,
  "bracketSameLine": false,
  "arrowParens": "always",
  "endOfLine": "lf",
  "jsxSingleQuote": false
}
```
author: Yugveer06

comments.body: Hi, @Yugveer06. I was also planning to add Prettier for consistent formatting. Thank you for pointing it out. üëç
